intro: Raphanus sativus var. salmoneus, commonly known as the red radish, is a cultivar of the radish plant characterized by its deep red or pink root. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is native to Europe and western Asia. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm, with erect, branching stems and pinnately lobed leaves. Its roots are the primary edible part, often harvested when small for a crisp, spicy flavor. The plant is valued for its ornamental value as well as its culinary uses in various cuisines.
